Reviews.Title: “definately recommend it...”
Reviews.Author: chrisgr4
Reviews.Content: plus: 1) alessandro takes the hotel one level up...extremely helpful and kind and willing to answer all your questions.. 2) clean rooms, clean bathrooms and very comfortable 3) the mattress was the best i ever slept in hotels!!! 4) everything in this hotel was detailed planned and met all our needs 5) location is not bad..especcially if you want to walk rome instead of taking metro and buses Cons: 1) ithe hotel is in the 4th floor of an office building which makes the entrance a bit akward ( i knew it from before anyway so i cant complain) 2) 2-3 times when we went back to the hotel at night time we had to wait 2-3 min for someone to open to us (one day was raining also) 3) except from alessandro and roberto (i think) no one else in the reception spoke english and the communication was not so easy...they were willing to help though and very kind 4) for 165e/night i expected the breakfast a bit richer but for some other peolple it could be enough...i just didnt like some of the things they offer so i had only bread and cheese every morning.. In general words is a nice hotel and i recommend it to anyone that want to visit rome...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Base for Rome”
Reviews.Author: Hannah58
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3 night stay at Roma Boutique in Rome, & I would genuinely reccomend this little boutique hotel to all my friends & family, & anyone interested in visiting Rome. I was uncertain of the location & if this was a good area to stay in Rome, having never visited before, & to my delight the location was perfect. Just round the corner from Via Vanetto, an infamous street featured in La Dolce Vita. Via Vanetta was home to many of the more expensive hotels & had many bars & resteraunts, & also The Hard Rock Cafe. We walked everywere from Roma Boutique, The Spanish Steps, The Trevi Fountain, even the Collesium & The Forum. The only attraction we got a taxi to was The Vatican, & this cost only €13 which is really reasonable. The staff at Roma Boutique couldnt be more helpful & ensure you stay is special. Allesandro & Albert on the front desk reccomend many resteraunts & bars such as ‘The San Marco’ & ‘Historia Romana’ which I would reccomend highly. The breakfast is a small continental, and possibly not enough for some people, but its complimentary & you can’t complain getting a free coffee, coisant & cereal brought to your door every morning on a tray, it sets you up for the morning. I would definately advise people to book Roma Boutique if you don’t wish to stay in a old fashioned b&b, as the rooms & modern, spotlessly clean, & the ambiance of the whole hotel is quite trendy. I enjoyed staying somewere nobody really knew about, as its not a big hotel with a lobby bar, which is why it is ideal as a base for a city break were you desire to be out most of the day anyway. Gorgeous room, amazing service, reasonably priced, what more can you want.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, contemporary stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: RooandBigJ
Reviews.Content: The hotel was just what it claimed to be. The rooms were contemporary and clean and well maintained, the staff were friendly and helpful. The breakfast served in the room was good - always there at the time requested. We had a bit of trouble with the door not locking properly, but we were provided with a key, and there always seemed to be someone on reception. The area around the hotel seemed really safe.

Reviews.Title: “Perfecto! Quiet retreat in the heart of Rome.”
Reviews.Author: Runningfool1980
Reviews.Content: I stayed for three nights and had a lovely time. It's a quiet, small hotel in a great part of town. The front desk people were so incredibly helpful and even celebrated the completion of the Rome marathon with me. The rooms are nice and modern - I had room 30, which has a sitting room as well as a bedroom. Overall a fantastic experience and would definitely go again. Ask them to make you a reservation at St Ana restaurant near Piazzia de Popolo. They did for us and it was the best food ever and only Italians (no tourists).

Reviews.Title: “charming!”
Reviews.Author: fernando s
Reviews.Content: for the first time I´ve been in an hotel which is just one flat of an old building, to my surprise it is a small 8 room hotel, but simply very nice! The staff is charming and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jean A
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 days. Lovely Hotel, great location, and staff couldn't do enough.We love Rome and this hotel added to a what was as always a lovely visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: amtm
Reviews.Content: I was a little confused about the whole staying at an office building which is supposed to be a hotel!!! I want to say I loved staying here for 3 days and having breakfast in bed every morning! Size of rooms is good for european standards, I didnt think the bed was hard and had comfortable nights sleep, 3 days is ok but I dont think I would do it longer, I like the whole hotel experience when its more than 3 days :) Main things: Its clean, somehow modern and very important they try their best to have happy costumers!. The location is not bad at all but you do have walk some to get to the attractions, dont think its around the corner. Its at least a 15 minute walk or so.

Reviews.Title: “Recomended”
Reviews.Author: stacy217
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights in Feb 2012. I very much enjoyed my stay. The rooms were stylish, clean and comfortable. Breakfast is brought to your room every morning, which I thought was great. The staff is very helpful and friendly. It is located on the 4th floor of an office building. There is no sign for the hotel on the street. This was not a problem for me as I had read this ahead of time and was not looking for one, so just be aware of that if you are looking for the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed for a 1 night brief visit”
Reviews.Author: EuroTravellerPG
Reviews.Content: I was visiting a client a few doors away from this hotel and they booked me in here. Euro 92 for the night. It had all I wanted (execpt a dinner service) but there were good restaurats within 100m. The breakfast tray was very large and delivered to my room. The internet was also included and worked well. I would stay here again Based on facilities, I'd rate it 4 out of 5 but upgraded to it to 5/5 due to the exceptional value

Reviews.Title: “It's like a secret hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrMeejana
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel last-minute for a few days city break and were very pleased with the welcome and hotel when we arrived. The owner and his team were all extremely helpful in assisting with questions about Rome, places to visit, etc, and made you feel like part of the family. The hotel has no visible signs outside, and you use a private entrance which gives you a sense of exclusivity. There is no bar or lobby so nowhere to sit other than your room, but we were not there to spend time lounging in the hotel! The room-served breakfast is very good and you can tailor it to your requirements.

Reviews.Title: “2nd tay”
Reviews.Author: JosephAC
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in 2008. On my recent trip to Europe, this October, I returned. Honestly, I knew what to expect, which is why I decided to come back. But you can never be sure because on my first stay they were newly established. However, the service remains at the level I experienced before - it hasn't waned. It seems that they added by a few rooms but it sill very quaint. A huge plus is you'll be close to all meaningful sites in Rome but you have to know were to find the hotel. There is no street exposure. It is praticaly in the shadow of the American Embassy and steps to Via Veneto. Alessandro and Monica will help in any way and the rest of the staff is very professional and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Canadian traveller”
Reviews.Author: B G
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay at Roma Boutique. Very clean, greatly attentive and accommodating staff. You could not ask for a better location. Rooms are beautiful and typically sized for the area. Highly recommend this hotel for anyone visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Todd p
Reviews.Content: Great breakfast in the rooftop room with a fabulous view

Reviews.Title: “"Fantastic experience"”
Reviews.Author: Rosa G
Reviews.Content: Had a fantastic experience at this hotel. It was very clean and comfortable, the service was outstanding the location perfect. I would definitely go back and also recommend it to any one visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Roma Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nydia B
Reviews.Content: We decided to book this hotel based on the online reviews and we think we made a great decision, we really enjoyed our stay here. The staff is extremely helpful and friendly. The breakfast is very pleasant, perfect to start the day. The decoration and room design is very nice, spacious and modern. Great shower! From the outside of the building you have no idea this boutique hotel is inside. We personally liked the idea of being in such a hidden gem, very few rooms and with personalized service. The location is really convenient, close to the metro and also easy walk access to main attractions. Price was a good deal, we booked it online. Regarding the comments about the bed, yes, the bed is harder than usual, Truthfully, the first night I felt that I didn't get a good night sleep but it was OK, the second and third night I didn't even care, I slept very comfortably.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: Coop207
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights with my boyfriend in September. Generally we had a lovely stay - I really liked the design of the hotel and the staff were very friendly. The location was also very convenient - walking distance to most of the main attractions, and breakfast was pleasant. However we did have a couple of issues - on the first night of our stay I found a used plaster in the shower, which was slightly offputting. We then discovered the our room did not lock, and on asking the staff at the hotel if we could move, were told that there were no other rooms available. Althogh there is a safe in each room, this was a bit of a worry for us. We were told the next day that the lock would be fixed or that we would be moved to a different room. Although somebody did come round to sort out the lock, it was never completely fixed.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Playmates
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Roma Boutique Hotel and loved it. It's an "oasis in Rome" because of it's great location near bus/metro stations, great part of time and quiet street. The room & bathroom were on the small side (with high ceilings) but clean and modern with everything we needed. Allessandro and his team are friendly and helpful. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Purely perfect”
Reviews.Author: SashaMasha
Reviews.Content: We stayed three wonderful days at Roma Boutique. Choosing a good (reasonable value for money) hotel in Rome was not an easy task. Our major prioirity was a center location. We checked tens of different places in the same price range. Most of them either offered very tiny rooms (some with a bathroom down the corridor, which is an absolute nonsense) or were shabby and untidy. The photos of RB on their web-site seemed really encouraging and the reviews were cool. So we made our choice and didn't get disappointed in the end, furthermore, we were absolutely delighted. The hotel interior turned to be very beautiful and modern. The room was spacious and I loved the white color furniture, especially the reptile-like texture of long chairs where we used to sit during breakfast. The bathroom was perfectly clean and tidy. The first thing that caught my eye there were three Etro designed small boxes. I'm not a crazy brand addict, I just love Etro prints and was happy to discover that a shower cap and other small stuff was packed in Etro style. Usually I never use the hotel shower&bath stuff, but their ginseng washing gel was really great!!! The only small complaint is the quality of bed. Some reviews had warned about it, but we didn't pay attention. In reality the bed happened to be really hard. Well, that's a matter of personal habits, anyway. But this fact didn't have any serious impact on us. After a long walking day around town we could sleep anywhere)))) Breakfast was nice. You just choose the time when it should be served to you and voila...you get a tray with a full cup of coffee, a glass of juice, a yoghurt and lots of pastry with butter and jam. And you also get a print digest of your local news. It was very nice) And the last but not the least....we'd like to say a special thanks to the staff. Alessandro is absolutely charming, Albert is very friendly, other guys are also great! Thanks for a perfect holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Basic B&B; excellent service; good location; nothing special”
Reviews.Author: familyinnh
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights on a business trip. Wireless Internet was spotty in my room, but good in all other places. They gave me a cable and were super-attentive. Clean, good bed, nice clean bathroom with shower, reasonable continental breakfast on a tray in your room. Not luxury; no restaurant or public areas to speak of. On the 5th floor of a nondescript office building. Next door to a police station. 2 Blocks from Via Veneto and a short walk to the Spanish Steps and subway stations. I give 4 stars for the category of a basic B&B, so 4 stars in the category, but not anything special otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “WELCOMING BASE FOR ROMA”
Reviews.Author: TNF84
Reviews.Content: Wonderful rooms and lovely people makes an ideal base for discovering Rome

Reviews.Title: “Very peaceful & exquisite attendtion to all details”
Reviews.Author: David A
Reviews.Content: Small chraming hotel with only 8 rooms, so you are allways be attended with real care, spacious, clean & quite rooms. Idaelly to rest after a long day walking Rome Very good comunicated, and a professional team. Breakfast included & served in the room.

Reviews.Title: “warm and nice place”
Reviews.Author: joigiannakopulou
Reviews.Content: i really loved this place and i will be more than happy to go there again my next holiday. there quiet room and the staff were very helpful to give any advice we needed.

Reviews.Title: “So Beautyful!!”
Reviews.Author: rostekele
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there at the end of June. Wonderful, quiet room (inside) and very helpful and pleasant staff. The breakfasts were outstanding with a great variety to choose from. Nice dinning room but we really liked taking our food out on the beautiful roof top terrace. Combine all this with the great location and we will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay”
Reviews.Author: joo007
Reviews.Content: This is one of our best ever places to stay while in Rome. We are a family of 4and got 2 rooms. Beds nice and big,comfortable and plenty of room, breakfast was a great beginning to the day. Alexandro and the team treat you like royalty, nothing is a problem. I would recommend this place to everyone that is going to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad if you like a hard bed and no frills”
Reviews.Author: blair2
Reviews.Content: We were referred to this hotel by some friends who really enjoyed their stay. We however didn't. The bad was so hard I had to move to another hotel. If you are used to beds like the heavenly bed, this will be a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a trip to Rome”
Reviews.Author: caramikekatie
Reviews.Content: The hotel was just wonderful. The staff was very friendly and attentive. The breakfast tray delivered to your room (at the time you request) was perfect to start the day. The hotel and room were very clean and well maintained. Loved the location, easy walk to Metro and taxi stand near by. I would certainly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but not enough for me to stay...”
Reviews.Author: superham
Reviews.Content: Cons: The wireless internet did not work in our room and barely worked in the hallway. However, Alessandro was trying to get that fixed. Our room had the lingering smell of cigarette smoke. Our shower drain was clogged. The continental breakfast was mediocre but none of these were dealbreakers. The big dealbreaker was that the bed is very hard! We had very restless sleep. Pros: The hotel is in a great location near Via Veneto, Villa Borghese, etc. Alessandro and the rest of the staff is VERY sweet and helpful and though we would have loved to stay, we just couldn't. Alessandro was very gracious about it.

Reviews.Title: “A Fabulous Gem in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Vikki52
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Roma Boutique Hotel recently and it was amazing. We had the suite with the living room, which worked out perfectly for my daughter. Alessandro and his staff were so helpful. We got great recommendations for restaurants nearby, where the locals eat. A great way to experience Roman cuisine. Our rooms were comfortable, the robes and slippers were a nice touch. The breakfast was perfect, delivered to our room at exactly the time we ordered. There was a request form to fill out, offering numerous types of coffee, juices,cereals and yummy pastries. A great location in the heart of Rome, thanks again. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “it is not an h0tel but rooms to let only”
Reviews.Author: yosit6
Reviews.Content: I arrived to the rome boutique and could not find any hotel There is no lobby, no seating place, no reception or dining room, just nothing only a corridor and 7 rooms on the 4th floor of an old building Breakfast is served in the room, because there is nowhere else to eat breakfast The photos in the web site show the entrance to the building and not the lobby of the hotel if you are looking for an hotel dont go there because they are only rooms to let and not any kind of hotel yosef israel

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be better!”
Reviews.Author: drama4adi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Roma Boutique Hotel in April of 2011 for our honeymoon, and it couldn't have been more perfect. The location was ideal! The hotel is a few doors down from a police station and around the corner from the American Embassy. Via Veneto, the main street near by, is in a good area and even at night, we felt comfortable walking around. It is just a short walk to the nearest metro station and there are tons of cafe's and restaurants nearby. The breakfast served in the room (delivered with the US News) was a great way to start our day. The beds were slightly hard for American standards, but a MILLION times better than other Roman hotel beds that I have used in the past. We slept great! Out of the 7 rooms that the hotel offers, we lucked out and got one of the larger ones, #30, which was equipped with a stocked bar, including waters, sodas and flavored drinks in a refrigerator. There was a full size computer that was free to use and complimentary wifi throughout the hotel. The TV had full satellite which had a lot of channel choices, including "ESPN America." What stood out the most was the outstanding customer service. Alessandro was exceptionally kind, helping us out with baggage, giving us tips about the city, and placing roses in our room while we were out for the day, with a note wishing us a happy honeymoon. All the hotel staff members were extremely nice, helpful, and welcoming. They all spoke English as well, which can be comforting to travelers! When we return to Rome, we won't even consider staying anyplace else and have already recommended Roma Boutique to friends!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful City, Wonderful Hotel, Even better food!”
Reviews.Author: AirCon_Boy
Reviews.Content: My (then) girlfiriend and I stayed at the hotel over the Valentines weekend this year. We had the room number 30 which had only been open a month. In a word A-MAZING! The "room" had a bathroom, good size bedroom and adjoining living room!! The only disappointing aspect was that there weren't any nice views of Rome, only of the next door building and its hairy builders! Other than that, the breakfast which was bought to your room each morning was fantastic, fresh coffee, pastries, cereal and fresh juice. To be honest I really miss that every morning, but apparently it would be too expensive for me to hire someone to come and do that for me every morning ....pfffft. We visited all the wonderful sites in Rome over the weekend, from beautiful fountains to the fantastic sistine chapel, each cultural site better than the last. Food wise, can thoroughly recommend the lobster and tagliatelle in any of the fine restaurants! Mmm But I guess for me the highlight of the weekend was proposing to my beautiful girlfriend in our wonderful room…..thank god she said “yes”! Roma bella!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous Service and Location!!!!”
Reviews.Author: RStrong
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Roma Boutique Hotel from 28 November 2010 thru 2 December 2010. The stay was faboulous. I have traveled the world and stayed at many great and not so great hotels. The hotel is in a nondescript building on the corner of Via Toscana. I would suggest using a taxi to find the hotel. You really do not need a car. Plus Rome parking is next to impossible. The hotel is located two blocks from the Via Veneto and about five blocks from an entrance to the Villa Bhorghese. Also, the American Embassy and a Police Station are very near. Restaurants are plentiful in the area in any direction. The hotel is in a great location for walking to all the tourist sites. It is also a short cab ride to other parts of the city if you prefer to go off the beaten path. We were greated by Alessandro, and from that moment on all our cares were fulfilled. The rooms are nice with ample closet space and a fairly large bathroom. The bed was queen size, firm, and clean. There was also a nice flat screen tv in the room. We had a room with a balcony which was nice to check the weather and look up and down the street. You are on a side street off the Via Veneto so it is not quiet nor is it excessively noisy. Alessandro and the rest of the staff of the Roma Boutique Hotel are amazing and attentive to your every need. They are great at suggesting places to eat lunch and dinner. You just need to tell them what you have a taste for, be it steak, seafood, regional, etc.. They also have suggestions for shopping areas within Rome. We were estactic with our stay and will stay there again on our next visit. Remember that this is a boutique hotel with limited rooms and no restaurant. You will not be disappointed staying in this wonderful hotel while in Rome, it is truly a gem!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: MegHeidemann
Reviews.Content: My husband I stayed here for 3 nights while in Rome. Location is great. It iw close to the Spanish steps, and the American embassy. it is in a very safe location. Like other travelers said, it is on the 4th floor of an office building. the Rooms are extremely clean. they provide robes/slippers and turn down service. they go above and beyond with service. breakfast served to room in the AM. They provided a private car to take us to the airport at no charge. I would recommend the hotel if you don't mind small hotel rooms. they are tiny, as are the bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: travelLi
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the Roma Boutique Hotel. The staff were very helpful, friendly and professional. The rooms were small, but sufficient, and the coffee in the mornings was incredible! No problem recommending this hotel to anyone. The only thing we did notice was that the walls seemed quite thin, and when anything was happening out in the hallway, it was easily heard in the room. However, this was only an issue one night.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, desing, ubication, hospitality...all that you can wish!”
Reviews.Author: mari014
Reviews.Content: Roma Boutique Hotel, made the diference in our trip. Very well location in downtown, in a very security area... Very nice decoration, very clean, excellent breakfast all the contitions to relax and enjoy your staying in Rome. Whith out any personal interest, the personal gives you always the best advises to discover Rome: places, food, traditions and culture. Monica, Roberto and Alessandro, makes you feel that you find new friends in Rome. If i go back to Rome, i don't have to think twice where to stay, my desotion is taken: RBH

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in Roma”
Reviews.Author: fabrice73
Reviews.Content: We traveled to this hotel for a three day vacation in Roma. We had a large suite with a two rooms, large bedroom and small lounge. I never had such an hotel in Roma and it was an excellent surprise. Nice staff, convenient location (bus 1 minute away, urderground quick to access, good furniture, sound sleep. As written in some critics, the view from the room is nothing fantastic but the view inside the room is really cool. Wifi access was a bit slow initially but worked OK. Cable TV same thing. Breakfast was nice (although i prefer going to a roman cafe for breakfast, we stayed and enjoyed the breakfast from the hotel) Si definitely a place to go in Roma. On our next trip, we will try to stay there. Be carefull it is a small hotel and can be fast full.

Reviews.Title: “Odd but has it all”
Reviews.Author: ItalyTrip2010
Reviews.Content: We booked into this hotel for 2 nights after reading these reviews. It is an odd place. Like mentioned by other folks it is like someone bought a few apartments and combined them into a tiny hotel. However it had everything you need. Breakfast is a typical contintenal style and we liked having it served in our room. Location of the rooms is quiet to street noise but you can hear everything going outside your door. People coming and going and conversations in reception. We felt as though we were staying at relatives you don't know well. There is a small grocery store downstairs that is very handy for stocking up on essentials. Our main criticism was with how hard the beds were but other hotels in Italy also had beds like this.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place! Would definitely go back!”
Reviews.Author: MarthaLD
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights during the first part of our trip to Italy. We loved it! The room was bigger than I expected, and everything was sparkling clean and very modern. I agree with another commenter that the bed was stiff, but other than that we have no complaints. We walked everywhere, and found it convenient to all sites in Rome. We also had the best wifi service we found in any hotel - much better than in much pricier hotels we stayed in. As for the breakfast, we loved having it delivered in the morning at whatever time we wanted. A commenter complained about not having a common area to eat like at a traditional hotel, but to us that made it a much more personal and private experience, like free room service every day. Also, the service was outstanding. They called us cabs, helped us get a car service to pick us up at the airport after our red-eye flight, suggested restaurants, and were some of the friendliest staff we met in Italy. Loved these people and truly enjoyed the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Service is amazing in this peculiar hotel”
Reviews.Author: mariatraveler
Reviews.Content: I say peculiar because this hotel is actually inside an apartment building, on the 4th floor, like someone bought a few apartments and combined them into modern, elegant hotel rooms. This is also why the hotel is hard to find, because you never imagine to look for the hotel name on the buzzer of an apartment building! there's no sign outside because it's a historical building and they have been denied may times the request to put a small sign outside. The location is very good, very nice neighborhood and 2 blocks from Villa Borghese, a really nice park where the Borghese gallery is. It's also walking distance from the Barberini metro stop. Alessandro was awesomely nice and helpful! the service was excellent in this respect. He recommended great places to eat and gave us tips about other stuff. The other guy working at night wasn't as nice or friendly. The room was small, which is standard in europe and I'm OK with, but what I didn't like was that there is nowhere else in the hotel to have breakfast, so we had to empty the desk and have breakfast there when they brought it. I feel that if you're forced to have breakfast in the bedroom you should at least have a dedicated table for it. I liked the hotel and I loved Alessandro, but to be honest but for the price we paid ($300) I feel we could have been in a more comfortable place with the advantages of a "real" hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Service”
Reviews.Author: Mpls_Peeps
Reviews.Content: Similar to the other reviews I thought that the service and location were great. We really enjoyed the area which was close to the Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps and lots of bars/restaurants which were so close (personal restaurant recommendation within walking distance Hosteria Romana - near the Trevi Fountain is awesome). The service at the hotel was also great. We got assistance on how to use the local subway system, restaurants if we wanted, and just general assistance. For us the rooms worked... they were quite small but we were fine with that. Loved having wireless internet access so that was a huge plus. We're not big breakfast people so the comments on breakfast from others are true. We just don't value that as much. We also never had any trouble finding the hotel. I would imagine you may if you try to find it on your own but we took a cab from the airport and they found it without any problems. In general, given the money I paid for the room I thought it was perfect for our needs. As said above the fantastic service and good location are really the draw to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: walt_de
Reviews.Content: Hotel is clean, in good location, but very expensive. You can find close to this hotel many 5 stars hotels for the same price.The breakfast was good, but we did not like to eat in room, prefer even small restaurant, but not in bed dinning. Anyway, the hotel has a great staff, they were polite and always smiling.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: johniis
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights before heading up to Tuscany. The hotel is just as good as all the previous reviews promised it would be. Good old Trip Advisor strikes again. We get the hotel car to meet us at the Airport after reading other reviews of how tricky this place was to find. We needn't have bothered. Anyone who can hold a map the right way up can find this hotel! We walked everywhere from the hotel, St Peters Sq, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps and the Colloseum plus many others. It is really well situated. Alessandro and his team are nothing but professional, we got tips on everything from where to eat to how to get there. I ca thouroughly reccomend this hotel for its personal service, great location (it really is in a peaceful corner of Rome!) and big well appointed rooms. Alessandro even managed to courier my mobile to our hotel in Tuscany after I left it behind. He really is a great host. Stay at one of the chain hotels if you want run of the mill service, stay here if you want the personal touch from people who love their city and want you to love it too.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: NorthernWanderer0
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure if this a hotel or B & B. Very few rooms, no street signage so difficult to find first off, no common areas or cafe/coffee shop etc Breakfast can only be in the room and is basic. Room a reasonable size. Quiet. Bed VERY firm. Staff are very helpful. BUT, when we checked in there was a used sanitary pad in our bathroom, and there was hair from the previous clients in the shower, which was still there throughout our stay. Is not 4 star in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast blows...”
Reviews.Author: rmpenner
Reviews.Content: We selected Roma Boutique on the strength of its TA reviews, but were disappointment particularly with breakfast. The room was very nice and of medium size (by European standards - small by US standards). The people were extremely pleasant and helpful, with reservations etc. But the hotel had no common spaces for patrons to enjoy, including no area for eating breakfast, so breakfast was served at a pre-determined time in your room. Since these rooms are "small", there is little room to enjoy this meal and frankly, we found it a little gross to be eating in close proximity to our dirty cloth, bathroom etc. Beyond this, the meal was mediocre consisting of luke-warm coffee, yogart, boxed cereal, and a few pastries. For the money - you can stay at a 5star hotel within blocks of Roma Boutique. That's what we'll do next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, made our stay perfect”
Reviews.Author: Gemma1977
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in September 2010. I'd been a little worried by some comments about difficulty finding hotel and being buzzed in at night, but had no problems at all. Alessandro was excellent right from check-in, showing us where we were in Rome and showing the best routes to the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain (10-15 minutes walk from hotel). He recommended some great restaurants for lunch and dinner over the weekend and even booked tables for us. All were slightly off the beaten track and had lovely food every time. All the other staff were great too. Rooms are contemporary and spotlessly clean and breakfast in the morning served to the room on silver tray was a nice touch. Good bathroom and huge shower. Only very tiny thing I would change is a slightly softer bed, but still slept fine, that's just personal taste! Rome was easy to walk round from the hotel and only 5 min walk to Metro to get to Vatican City. Overall, great hotel that made our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Service, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: dublinbucki
Reviews.Content: A perfect stay with owners that really understand hospitality. Start with a great location near Via Veneto. Close to Italy's Embassy Row as well, so there was a police car on the corner 24 hours a day (talk about a safe location!). Quiet and quirky, only 8 rooms on the 4th floor of an office building, but nice decor and very quiet. We stayed 4 days, renting two rooms. Rooms were small, but very clean. Nice breakfast included in price, served in your room every morning. Alessandro and his staff really take an interest in your enjoyment of the city, recommending sites and restaurants, and making arrangements for you. Block from big cab line, walking distance to Spanish Steps/Trevi fountain, wonderful Borghese Museum and all the high-end fashion shopping you could ever want. Next door to a small supermarket, very convenient and cost effective for snacks, beverages. A perfect base for our Rome trip. Highly recommend if you value personal service over big hotel amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but overall poor value for money. Overrated,”
Reviews.Author: RasberrySundae
Reviews.Content: 2 positive points for this hotel are its location (right next to Via Veneto and few minutes walk to Barberini metro station and the shopping district) and the hotel staff. The receptionists were very helpful throughout our stay. However, I find the value of money for this hotel poor to average. We were lucky that we had the suite for €170 a night (the only one of the hotel). However, my sister paid €190 a night and got a much smaller room, and all other rooms are like hers. So if you aren't lucky to get the suite, €170 is quite expensive for what you get. The hotel is located in an apartment building (itself is an apartment converted into a hotel), with an old and smelly entrance and extremely small elevator. Also, we had our breakfast served in the room everyday, which was a treat, but the bread of poor quality and there’re no fruits. As the building is quite old, the soundproof system was quite bad. We heard all conversations of our neighbors and the washing machines all night.

Reviews.Title: “The reviews are backed up by the reality”
Reviews.Author: timbo1960
Reviews.Content: Previous reviews are pretty much on the money. We had a lovely stay at the hotel. Plus points 1. Location, quiet but not off the beaten track. 2 Room perfect for city break - no great frills but clean and comfortable. 3 A v. firm mattress, great for my dodgy back 4 breakfast - nice to have this in the room 5 Lift worked and I used it 6 Numerous stairs for Mrs G who insisted on using them (?!!) 6 Restaurant recommendations from staff - Papa Bacchus further up the street ,pricey but a real find - try the fillet with gorgonzola and pear in a filo basket, blissful so good I went back and had another one. 7 Value for money - I trawled the internet and could not beat this package. You are not paying for a gym or other services you are not going to use Minuses 1. Tough to find - my tip, (a) spot the unmissable police station,(b) spot the spar store next down the street, then (c) go to the DOUBLE doorway further down the street from the shop and (d) squint hard at the name tags to the buzzers and hey presto you will see a reference to the hotel. (d) don't bother asking the locals/police in the squad car permanently parked on the corner - they are clueless! 2. Hard floors throughout so can be a bit noisy when others are moving around. All in all perfect for couples not for young boisterous families.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous small hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Girltraveler0
Reviews.Content: My family and I (2 adults, two teens aged 18 & 19) stayed at the wonderful Roma Boutique Hotel in June/July--a delightful surprise right off the Via Veneto. Hotelier Alessandro Trapasso has done a great job with his 8-room family-run hotel. The quality, personal attention to detail and care are what you would expect from much larger hotel. Alessandro and Robert assisted with everything from dinner suggestions to tour reservations and shopping and were patient with our many questions, both before and during our stay. If you have teens or more than 2 adults, be sure to ask for the 2 bedroom 'apartment' (more like a suite with one bathroom), it was perfect! A nice continental breakfast and transportation from the airport were also included . The hotel is also within easy reach of all of the major sights, shopping, etc--very convenient. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous boutique hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: hannahspencer16
Reviews.Content: This was one of two hotels we stayed in in Rome whilst on our honeymoon. The hotel is an apartment in a large building. As long as you have a map and the skills, it was easy to find. Easy to miss as there is no sign, just a labelled buzzer once you arrive at the building. We walked there from the nearest Metro station; about a 15 minute walk uphill with suitcases. The area is fantastic and I did not appreciate this until we stayed in a lesser location at the other hotel. It is amongst the executive hotels in the embassy district and on the edge of Via Veneta which is full of restaurants and bars. The welcome was very friendly and the staff were always talkative and friendly, happy to help with any advice you need about where to go etc. The room was beautifully decorated with great facilities. You could hear a bit of noise from the reception area in the mornings and the views from the window weren't great at all. The breakfast was very satisfactory, and served in your room at a time good for you. A gorgeous little chocolate was left on your pillow after every housekeeping service. Free internet was very nice in a city where nothing comes cheap. The staff waiving our minibar bill on check out was also a lovely touch. All in all, a fantastic room in a lovely little hotel. It is more than I'd ever pay for a hotel but we wanted to treat ourselves for our honeymoon, and what a treat it was. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Really Lovely Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: brennee2004
Reviews.Content: I stayed 5 nights at the Roma Boutique Hotel, with no regrets at all. I based my choice on the reviews here on TripAdvisor, since this was my first visit to Rome. They had arranged a car/driver to pick me up at the airport, and even though my flight was delayed and didn't arrive until 1:00am, the driver was there. The room was moderate in size. I've stayed in smaller and larger, so I'd say just about right. It was spotlessly clean and well appointed. The bathroom was modern and lovely, with a beautiful shower with plently of water pressure and good hot water. The toiletries were Etro. The breakfast tray arrived exactly as requested each day. The pastries were fine, the cereal was good, the coffee was good, and the yogurt and juice good. Lots of choices of jams, Nutella, honey, butter, and cream cheese to use on the breads. It wasn't fancy, but was a good way to start the day without having to go out to a restaurant. There were a couple of little things I would like different. First, a kettle in the room would have been really nice, although they will get you boiled water ANY TIME. Second, I was in room 28 which just happened to be next to the station where they make the breakfast trays up. The room clearly shared a wall with where the espresso machine was, and I could hear it "steaming" from first thing in the morning, to night. It wasn't terrible, but it was there. Lastly, like most European cities, electricity is expensive and the room outlets, etc., are controlled by putting your card in a slot. Unfortunately, the bar fridge was attached to this cycle, so nothing was ever cold in the fridge, because every time I left the hotel, the power was off. In the end, absolutely terrific stay. They recommended restaurants, including Hosteria Romana, The Forum Restaurant for pizza, and Papa Baccus right up the street from the hotel. All of their recommendations were great. In fact, the only time I had a disappointing meal was when I'd forgotten to ask for a recommendation and chose by myself. Their is a Spar grocery store two doors down from the hotel, so you can get any food/drink stuff you need. Walking to all major attractions is easy and pleasant. I walked to the Vatican, the Colloseum, and every other attraction on the tourist map. Allessandro and his team make your stay really enjoyable and truly treat their guests as family. I would highly recommend this boutique hotel (and have already) to anyone looking for a lovely, clean, friendly hotel, that is in a great location. I will go back to Rome, and I will go back to the Roma Boutique Hotel. Thank you, Allessandro!!!

Reviews.Title: “A superb way to start our Italy vacation...”
Reviews.Author: nikkibgood
Reviews.Content: A superb way to start our Italy vacation! From the pick up at the airport to the numerous outstanding restaurant recommendations, Alessandro and his staff provided us with a wonderful place to return after a day of touring the sites. The hotel is clean, modern, sleek and breakfast brought to your room on a tray us THE most civilized way to start your day!! We had a fantastic 3 days thanks to the clean comfy rooms, lovely breakfast and warm atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Good Location and Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: BrisbaneBrowny
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Roma Boutique recently with some friends from the UK, the hotel is in an excellent location, very safe and quiet, we walked to all the major attractions (even in the 37 degree heat) and the hotel staff were exceptional (Thankyou Alessandro). If you are looking to stay in Rome then this hotel will not disappoint you.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel - ideally located, quiet and beautifully appointed with amazing hospitality”
Reviews.Author: missmillyMelbourne
Reviews.Content: The Roma Boutique Hotel was ideally located just behind the Via Veneto and within easy walking distance or a short taxi ride to all of Rome's main attractions. The hotel - is small and located on the fourth floor (access via elevator) of an office building but the rooms are large, high ceilings, beautifully decorated and the beds are extremely comfortable. the hotel is clean and because it is owned and run by a local Italian family you get a genuine sense of care and hospitality. Breakfast - continental served in your room every day is generous with cereal's, breads and jams, juice, tea and coffee - is plenty to start the day. The Hotel is also conveniently located above a supermarket so you can easily access snacks, drinks and a convenient lunch. The Villa Borghese is only 10 mins walk so a picnic in the park is great for a slower pace experience. I can highly recommend getting up between 5.00 - 6.00am to photograph the Trevi Fountain and Spainish Steps which are only 10 mins walk - there was no one around and I just love my photo's - worth the early morning wake up call. I can highly recommend the Hotel and I spent 7 days there and I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room and very helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: yundie
Reviews.Content: A bit hard to find as we didn't read the directions properly but a lovely surprise when we got there. Stayed in suite and the extra space made up for the outlook . Bed very comfortable and staff very helpful. Good location for walking around and on good bus routes. Rome wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Honeymoon in Roma Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: holidayaddict23
Reviews.Content: We returned from this hotel on 2nd July after 4 nights and we loved it. The staff and service were wonderful and so friendly. I never sleep well on holiday but this is the best I have ever slept away from home. I think this is probably because the intimate size of the hotel felt homely and I felt very safe in the building and area, not to mention the bed being very comfortable. I am fed up of hotel beds that feel as if the mattresses have gone way past their best - this was nothing like that. The continental breakfast served in the room was great to tuck in to whilst getting ready in the morning and the decor of the hotel was lovely. I especially loved the shower! It seems some people have a bit of an issue with the fact that this hotel is on one floor of a fancy office building, so if you like a big hotel with a doorman and and it's own bar then this isn't for you. If, however, you like ameneties on your doorstep and somewhere peaceful and welcoming to stroll home to in the evening with a personal feel, this is perfect. We hope to return to Rome and wouldn't book anywhere else for fear of being disappointed and wishing we had returned here.

Reviews.Title: “The Consistent Reviews Are Accurate”
Reviews.Author: Manoavalley2
Reviews.Content: This hotel, in a business building on the fourth floor is very clean, modern and near the Via Veneto's many restaurants and shops. The friendly and helpful service from owner and manager, Alessandro and his staff and family was outstanding. His suggestions for dinner were excellent. The room was typcally small but very efficient. There was no breakfast room so we ordered breakfast the night before and it was delivered to our room on time. The breakfast was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Best staff in Italy!”
Reviews.Author: RJV2010
Reviews.Content: Alessandro and all other staff members were extremely helpful and welcoming. The modern décor is inviting and peaceful. The breakfast served daily in your room was most enjoyable. All the restaurant recommendations were fabulous! The location is in a nice quiet area of town. Our favorite part of Rome was the Roma Boutique and its excellent staff!

Reviews.Title: “Yes, it is what most people say it is ...”
Reviews.Author: Dtheresa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean, comfortable and contemporary. The staff is helpful, professional and friendly. Finding this boutique hotel in an office building (not in the North American sense of the word) is a little odd, but the neighbourhood is quite tony and some very fancy hotels are close by if you care to get very little bang for your buck. We found the hotel blissfully quiet after a day of walking around fabulous Rome. We enjoyed coming back to a spotless room with crisp bed linen. The continental breakfest was a great start to the day especially since some very serious eating is to be done later in the day when in Rome! We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not what everyone says”
Reviews.Author: hotelie2004
Reviews.Content: I was very excited to stay at this boutique hotel based on the ratings . I wouldn't call it a hotel. Its the 4th floor of an office building with one hallway, with thin walls, some plaster, and high style decorations. You must ring a buzzer at the st level (there is no main entrance) and haul your own luggage. The gentleman who greeted us during the day was very nice and helpful; However, the night staff was less so. We asked for a dinner reservation and he could only recommend one restaurant that someone else that worked for the hotel worked at. He could not call and make a reservation at a place we were recommended by friends because he could not make outgoing calls from the hotel; he could not even tell us the location when I gave street name and metro location; he wouldn't look it up for us; we were ensured that our taxi in the morning would take credit card and it did not leaving trouble getting cash and getting to the airport; when we left the gentleman at the desk watched my husband trying to get our heaving bags down the steps without helping; they do no exchange cash at the hotel. Its a clean room with a nice guy during the day in an office building. If it is worth 200E to you, then this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: LondonKymani
Reviews.Content: The Roma Boutique hotel is situated on Via Toscana not far from the Spanish Steps, its on the seventh floor of a building and only a small placque and buzzer on the side of the building reveals the sight of the hotel, obviously do not need to advertise it!! There is a tiny little lift or the stairs. Alessandro welcomed us and we were allocated our room, the room was lovely, very clean, smart, modern furnishings with a balcony, and a great bathroom, no bath but a really good large shower. Excellent location and walking distance to all the sights, apart from the Vatican of which we opted to use the Metro, only a few euros and not far from the hotel, couple of stops and we were there - it does make the london tube seem pretty clean though as it was quite dirty! The building of which the hotel is housed closes the main front doors at 7pm so you buzz the hotel for entry from then on, but it is 24hrs reception - the little man who does the night shift asleep in his pyjamas at the reception when getting back late at night!! In the evening you fill in a little form for what you would like for breakfast, which is then served at a time of your choice in your room, nice touch but would have been nice to have something cooked as well. On our last evening my partner asked Alessandro for a recommended restaurant for a special evening, we had seen previously guest reviews saying how wonderful the restaurants he had recommended were so didnt think we could go wrong. The restaurant he had, supposedly, booked for us was just off Piazza del Popolo called Ana. Arrived outside the restaurant, which was on lower ground level and went down the stairs to the main entrance, there was no-one around so stood for a few minutes, went back up had a look at the menu on board outside and went back in again, still no-one around so went through into the main room which was approx half full and there were some waiters around who looked past us until one of them spoke to us asked if we wanted a table, my partner explained we had a reservation and he duly took us past some tables which had reservations and sat us down at a table without one!! We then sat for longer than you should have to without a menu or drinks before another waiter zipped past asking if we wanted a menu, doesnt seem to much to ask?!?, and said he would be back with them, by this point we had lost our patience and got up and left and he said goodbye as we went! Charming!! The restaurant seemed like a genuine italian for italians but it doesn't mean you should forsake service and manners for tourists, but perhaps we just got unlucky that time? Left dissapointed but not for long, after finding a good, friendly restaurant close by with lovely food and wine. All in a good hotel in great location with lovely modern, quiet rooms.

Reviews.Title: “What a Gem in Heart of the City”
Reviews.Author: CrystalRose54
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights here and found it to be excellantly placed for all sightseeing and just off the Via Veneto. Alessandro & all his staff could not do enough for us. All recommendations for restaurants were superb and not touristy at all. Would recommend to my Mother, say no more!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent staff, personalized attention”
Reviews.Author: Sirjhay
Reviews.Content: Great quiet location, perfect if you want to walk the city or you prefer to take the subway. Small and quiet on the fourth floor of a well renovated older building in a very safe area. Excellent breakfast delivered to your room. Great spacious bathroom. The staff are enthusiastically helpful and attentive to your needs. The rooms are a decent size and very good for Rome albeit a bit sparse onart - very functional and modern. Everything works!

Reviews.Title: “These guys not just your hosts they become your friends.”
Reviews.Author: traveler938
Reviews.Content: We were very satisfied with the Roma Boutique. While it is lacking in public space the location affords sufficient diversion from restaurants to bars, to convenience store next door, etc. Breakfast in the room was very good and timely. Internet was fast and free. Alexandro even refused payment for a bottle of gin from the mini-bar. Although this is quite attractive as a business mans hotel, it provide us with a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Staff so friendly and helpful”
Reviews.Author: debbai
Reviews.Content: just wanted to say how wonderful a stay we had in this hotel would recommend it to anyone thd staff could not do enough and after 5 weeks of travelling all over it was a nice welcome to good hospitality ...................

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: amanda11705
Reviews.Content: This is a jewel of a hotel. Hidden away in an office building but the rooms have true charm. The staff is very helpful - gave us a map and directions every day. We walked everywhere! Located off stylish Via Veneto and close to metro. Breakfast in bed every day was a special treat! Loved our stay.

Reviews.Title: “It was a great hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: fra33
Reviews.Content: We had a really good time!The hotel is marvellous!We had the opportunity to do a lot of sightseeing!Spacious rooms and really helpful and generous staff!

Reviews.Title: “Roma Boutique was the PERFECT start to 1st trip to Italy!”
Reviews.Author: Travelistah
Reviews.Content: The staff at Roma Boutique went above and beyond to make our stay amazing. We loved Rome and loved our stay at this hotel. Everyone here was gracious and accomodating in every way. We also reccomend taking the restaurant advice and allowing the staff to make the dinner reservations - we never went wrong when following their lead! If we had to mention any downsides, it would be that the beds are pretty hard (but we slept well anyway from all the walking ;) and the hotel is about a 10-15 minute walk to the heart of the city, which we never minded at all. We would absolutely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at a great price”
Reviews.Author: jjair09
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Roma Boutique for the last two days of our stay in Rome. The staff there are more than awesome. They were kind enough to make sure my AS ROMA tickets were received on time. The hotel is only one level in a larger building. The rooms are small but clean and modern. You get free wi-fi as well as alot more English-Speaking channels than most hotels we stayed at. The breakfast is superb and delivered to your door - pastry, yogurt, bread, milk, coffee, orange juice, ect. The only slight negative was how far it up the "hill" it was from the "happening" areas. However, it's about 15 minute walk to Trevi Fountain, which is not that bad.

Reviews.Title: “Unique”
Reviews.Author: Maceiras
Reviews.Content: Wonderful, tiny hotel near Via Veneto in Rome. The rooms are sparkling with all the amenities. You get free pickup at the airport and the service is excellent, with great recommendations for restaurants and logistics. Breakfast in room every morning at your leisure. Only drawbacks are no room service since the hotel is essentially a remodelled apartment in a posh part of the city, and slightly noisy hallway. Incredibly safe and clean. Would return any time.

Reviews.Title: “Great 4 star hotel - bit far from the sights though”
Reviews.Author: love2travelTokyo
Reviews.Content: This was the last of the 8 hotels we stayed during our Italian trip. It certainly is not well advsertised and is hidden away, but does have great funky modern clean rooms and great staff...but it is a bit far away from the major sights Pros - Room was very nice....very funky minimalist design, very modern bathroom, LCD TV etc - Service was great....all the people we met were very friendly - Breakfast in bed was fantastic - Value for 190 Euros was pretty good we thought, but we have paid less for 3 star places that we rated better during our trip (see my other reviews) Cons - Location - yes it is close to Via Veneto...but why would anyone want to be close to it? There's nothing there...just an overrated road with super expensive hotels and cafes...no shopping or anything cultural to see....to get to the Spanish Steps region is a good 20 min+ walk. We stayed at the Aleph which was more expensive, but much better location. Good thing though about the Roma is that there is a supermarket 20 metres away - Noise - walls / door is quite thin....from where we were, you can easily here people at reception or walking past - There's not always anyone at reception...one time we buzzed for 15 minutes before someone buzzed us in to the hotel If we ever come back to Rome, I think we would stay somewhere closer to the action

Reviews.Title: “Simply Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Maria_Acropolis
Reviews.Content: It was by far one of the most beautiful hotels we have been to! Very stylish rooms and the whole atmosphere was simple but elegant. Very good service and very kind staff. We highly reccommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Amazing Staff!”
Reviews.Author: HolidayBabe1212
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel last year for 4 nights for both my friend's and my 18th birthday. It is odd for it to be in an office block but once in the hotel you can't tell the difference. The men who were working on the reception during my stay were so polite and wonderfully helpful, telling us good places to eat, how to get about, checking we would get home ok after we had a night out and they even gave us a gift on our departure! The rooms are beautifully decorated and very clean. The bathroom is quite small but the shower is excellent and is well enjoyed after a long day exploring Rome! The breakfast has many options and all the food was very good, it can be delivered to your room whenever you want it. The location of the hotel is central enough, just off Via Veneto, one of the main streets in Rome (where you are able to get a bus to tour the city) which is full of great restaurants. All in all it is a fabulous hotel which I would thoroughly recommend with excellent staff who make the stay even more special!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: jay359
Reviews.Content: Can only echo the many othhr rave reviews. The staff are first class, friendly, helpful and nothing too much trouble. Looked after us brilliantly. Recommended some great restaurants (particularly Crispi 19) and brought hot milk for our baby with our breakfast every day. Probably not for everyone, but we particularly liked having breakfast in the room every morning and don't need all the useless add ons you get in a big hotel. Free internet in rooom a nice touch. Taxi pick up and return to the airport arranged by Allessandro and worked perfectly. All in all an excellent base for a long weekend in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Greatest Service!”
Reviews.Author: LoveTravelling389
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last year for our Rome trip and thought that I would come in to drop a few lines about the hotel since me and my boyfriend had such an amazing time there. The service was just incredible! I would say the best that we have ever encoutered, The hotel was a small hotel and had combined receptionist/concierge together. Nothing but the best recommendatioins of where to go, eat and chill. We had the best food while we were there, nothing but very nice, local and amazing places as well as hidden trattorias with the best bucatoni amtriciana! (near the collosseum cant remember the restaurant name but remember it was some numbers in italian) I alaways felt welcomed when coming back from a long day. Just amazing. Since there was no restaurant, breakfast was served in the room which was very charming. The day before they would ask what time we would like the breakfast and it would come in trays in the morning continental style, pastry, yogurt and coffee. Great Italian coffee! The only thing is that the pastry is not excellent but everything else was great and anyways, we never had much at breakfast since we were always patrolling out for great italian food recommended by the hotel for lunch. The rooms as always in Europe was not very big but was great. I loved their bathroom amenities which was from Etro. I never knew they also do toiletries but it just added a chic touch to the hotel even more =) Location was good. We liked walking around Rome and it was quite centralized even though not exactly in the middle middle (Middle referring to the Spanish Steps etc). But its only around a 10-15 minutes depending on the pace walk to there. This is the only hotel I would ever stay in in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly nice but poor value”
Reviews.Author: chris706
Reviews.Content: Located on the fourth floor of an office building this hotel has a slightly odd location. It is perfectly nice (clean, smart bathroom etc) but not the quality that you would expect for the premium price we paid (fairly small room, shower only, average breakfast). It also had the hardest bed in any hotel I have stayed in - ok if thats your preference. However the staff could not be faulted - helpful and attentive. The main point is that is pricing itself against 4/5* hotels but should be against 3/4*.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay....”
Reviews.Author: Miffers
Reviews.Content: We like the Boutique Hotel concept and the Roma lived up to expectation from previous positive reviews. Hotel transfer from the airport was arranged contacting the hotel direct via email, response was immediate. Staff could not have been more helpful in suggesting/recommending/booking restaurants etc. Rooms were chic, minimalist, comfortable and clean. The continental breakfast plentiful, served in room daily. WiFi accesss but did not use on this occasion. Liked the individuality of its discrete location. Within walking distance of the Via Veneto, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Borghese Park with Gallery/Museums and city bus tour stops. Felt safe - local police station and a mini supermarket close by. Above all it was the hospitality and personal service of all staff who added to the quality and enjoyment of our stay. We had a fantastic time on our 'Roman Holiday', all the more special for choosing this hotel. Would recommend and would return again. Memorable!

Reviews.Title: “Definite boutique hotel, bed hard as rocks!”
Reviews.Author: Fitzy2
Reviews.Content: I should countenance my comments by saying that I would normally try to stay at standard chain hotels, such as the Four Seasons or Sheraton. We booked this trip at relatively short notice and went with this hotel. It was E160 per night and I must say not worth it. It is a good 3 star hotel that tries to do more but is limited by the confines of the building. It is housed in an office block with no outside signage and therefore is difficult to find - we walked right by it and never noticed. It has the tiniest elevator up to the 4th floor where you are met by the nicest staff you could ask for. They were very obliging. However, the hotel lets them down. The entire hotel is on one small floor of this building with only about 10 rooms, so it feels more like a bed and breakfast. You can hear the front desk from your room, and I assume then that they could hear us. The room itself is modern and clean but just felt artifical. The bed is the hardest and most uncomfortable that I have ever slept on - even my wife gave out about it, and she normally never does. We were looking forward to getting home to our own bed (which is a hard ortho mattress!!). Also the television rarely worked, unclear of the exact reasons but told it was something to do with the modem! They did have free wifi though. However, the location is great and the breakfast was lovely and served in bed every day. Overall, I would not recommend this hotel to people that are not into the boutique thing. It's just overpriced for what you get. Also, as an aside, Rome is much nicer in the summer months if you are going.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended this”
Reviews.Author: pamisandison
Reviews.Content: I would very happy to recommend this hotel to others. The was great hotel, cleanliness, helpful and friendly staff. We have great time in romatic Roma city for our Honey moon. Will be back this for our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: eveenemean
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful. It was in a pretty good location and the price was good. The rooms were clean and had a friendly staff (most of the staff with a few exceptions). They upgraded our room for free since we were on our honeymoon. Breakfast was pretty good each day and was brought to your room so you could eat in bed! You would let them know the night before what you wanted they would bring it to you. Cold breakfast only which was ok. There was a small grocery store which was convenient. The hotel is small and in an office building, but no problems with that since we did not hang out in our room all day. It served the purpose of resting each night. The only negative was that the wals were kind of thin and in the morning we could hear the people in the kitchen right next to our room. Other than that no real complaints.

Reviews.Title: “The reviews tell the truth, cute hotel, fabulous service, perfect location, great price”
Reviews.Author: Nee33
Reviews.Content: Having seen the hotel recommended on Tripadvisor, we booked in. We noticed they offered free transport from the airport but apart from mentioning we were on a flight from Geneva and would arrive about 9 PM we didn't give the details. Imagine our surprise and delight when we came through Rome airport customs to find a man with a sign with my name on it! The van was huge and fit all our luggage.The entry is a bit of a surprise because the hotel is on the floor of an old commercial building, but it works fine and the fact that there is a police station next door is reassuring. There's also a small supermarket next door. We were the first to stay in their new 2 bedroom/1 bathroom suite. It's really nicely done and the value of 240 Euros at the peak season over the new year weekend was amazing. It's 2 blocks from the Via Venuto with great shopping and very expensive hotels.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden Gem- Thank you !!!”
Reviews.Author: Alexfarah
Reviews.Content: I took my boyfriend for a surpirse trip to Rome for 5 nights in December and chose Roma Boutique Hotel due to its locations and many great reviews and I was definately not dissapointed !!! This place is a hidden gem that reflects all the many qualities that a boutique Hotel should. It was personal, peaceful, quiet, unique and very special. Alessando the hotel manager and all his staff were very approachable and kind and helped me book things in the UK before our visit. The hotel itself was beautifully decorated, cleaned everyday, spacious rooms and simply fab with breakfast in bed every moring on a silver tray, making it that extra special ! We had a superior room with juliet balcony and the bed was very comfortable. There was a Tv in there too but who needs Tv when your in the most romantic city in the world !! We will definately be going back to stay with Alessandro at Roma Boutique hotel as this is definately not a hotel you should miss out on !!! Thank you so much for making my boyfriends birthday so special and for making me look like a fab girlfriend with you amazing hotel !! Ali and Ben from Bristol, UK.

Reviews.Title: “excelent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Akumik
Reviews.Content: The boutique hotels is excellent hotel, situation is not so far from metro stop so you can go easily to any historic site. Hotel is situated in the office building so you have to search a bit for first time, but advantage is that is quiet in the night. Hotel staff is really friendly and helpful for any questions, you can also ask with confidence for restaurant. Free taxi from airport is really super. The room was large enough, clean and comfortable (in superior room we had 160 cm bed), breakfast served in the room was nice (small disadvantage you have just your 1 glass of juice and coffee as well as everything is sweet, but you can buy more juice or something else in the shop on the street). Point negative, we had room 22 witch is superior room just next to entry and desk, so it was sometimes a bit noisy in the night and in the morning, but still acceptable. Also ask “EVERYTIME” for restaurant/pizzeria name or specific address, because without it you will never find it ;). The last point, the taxi to airport is not included in the price so you will have to pay extra 45 euros (disappointed by this point….). Globally I will return if I want to visit again Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing and great for romantic couples”
Reviews.Author: tripforever2010
Reviews.Content: I was there for a weekend with my wife and it was simply great. Just eight rooms lovely decorated with painted walls and many elegant details from Etro branded shampoo to very nice and soft slippers. It's really quite even dow you are in dowtown Rome and it's very closed to Via Veneto so you can walk 10 minuets and you get to Spanish stairs without taking cabs. Alessandro the hotel manager has been very friendly and he also suggested us a very good osteria in Trastevere where we had a gorgius dinner. We had a very good breakfast in our room and also the clean service was perfect. A perfect destination for romantic couples that prefer to avoid the traditional big but cold international hotel chains and discover Rome in a charmy and original way.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing hotel, with fantastic staff that cannot do enough for you!”
Reviews.Author: David_Clayton_London
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing hotel, if in Rome this must be your first choice. It rivals the most expensive and exclusive hotels in Rome for a fraction of the price. Alessandro and his team are fantastic and cannot do enough for you, the rooms are fantastic and the location is ideal from which to explore Rome. The hotel is situated in a quiet safe neighbourhood close to the American Embassy and a stones throw from the Spanish Steps. We walked everywhere in Rome from the hotel, even to the Vatican discovering all sorts of interesting sights, sounds and restaurants on the way. When we come back to Rome we will definitely be staying at the Roma Boutique Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Rooms, Food and Service”
Reviews.Author: bellajolie
Reviews.Content: Service- They allowed us to check in at 9:30am! That was super since we arrived on the train that morning and really needed sleep. They were also friendly and extremely helpful. Note that if you arrive by train, the limo service is not available. We were given a lovely gift upon departure as well. I read complaints about the buzzer, but there is a desk person on at all times, so no one is bothered when you press the buzzer. You may come and go as you please. Decoration- The rooms are truly amazing. I took notes and photos of all the cool things I saw so I could try and copy some of it! There were the most gorgeous crystal sconces beside the bed, recessed lighting, beatiful walls, curtains- Everything! Someone with very good taste and the ability to perfectly use space planned this hotel. Bathroom- Private bathroom, bidet and shower included. A fine size, well situated to feel plenty spacious. Included were large luxury bath products, shoe polishing mit, cotton swabs etc! One thing that would have been even better was 2 bars of soap. I had to keep moving from shower to sink. Comfort- The room was fairly large, and well designed. The mattress was VERY firm, the rooms spotless, the linens soft, and a plasma screen TV Food- Our room package included a breakfast which was quite lovely. Pastries, orange juice, tea coffee etc. All served to your room on a gorgeous tray. Location- This hotel isn't far from the sights, nor is it really close. It took us a good 15 minutes plus to get to most of the sights. I didn't mind the walking, so it suited me fine. If you take a cab, have a map with the hotel marked on it. Most cab drivers struggled a bit to find the hotel , as it is not located in a hotel district (a plus). Further, it is not advertised on the outside of the building. Accessibility- The hotel has about 3 small steps, so if you have a disability, this is not the place for you. The elevator fits one person with 2 suitcases at a time. Value- This room was a GREAT value for the money. Much cheaper than other smaller, less fancy rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and sophisticated hotel with a wonderfully friendly ambiance.”
Reviews.Author: essexgirl89
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a truly memorable stay at Roma Boutique. Alessandro and his staff were very welcoming and attentive, and to have the pleasure of a very generous breakfast in bed every morning was a real treat for us. We spent 4 very enjoyable days there, and will return! Its location is ideal, not far from the Metro, and a very pleasant walk down Via Veneto to the main tourist sites. Look no further for a fab hotel in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “out of sight hotel”
Reviews.Author: chefdave
Reviews.Content: If you didn't know where this hotel is you would walk right past. Situated on the fourth floor of an office block next door to the police station. There is no sign indicating its location only a small strip sign above the door bell, buzz this and you gain access to a large entrance hall, take the lift to the 4th floor and wow into another hidden world. You are greeted at reception like a long lost friend rather than a guest. We were shown to our room (no. 22). A spacious room with double doors leading to a Juliet balcony over looking the street below, a large bathroom with walk in shower and plenty of products, the room was very clean and well attended with linen changed every day. There was a mini bar but with hotel prices, stock up at the spar store next door. There is no restaurant or bar at the hotel but a generous breakfast is delivered to your room at your requested time. The staff are extremely friendly and gave great recommendations for restaurants both for lunch and dinner, the hotel is approx 15 minutes walk to both Trevi and the Spanish steps. Felt completely safe walking at night as the roads are well lite.

Reviews.Title: “Truly unbelievable experience....”
Reviews.Author: lcwnyc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Roma Boutique Hotel with my mother-in-law and her cousin for 4 days. From the moment we checked in, the staff (Alessandro, Roberto, Alberto and Ottavio) treated us like family. They went WAY ABOVE AND BEYOND to ensure our enjoyment and our comfort. From the restaurant recommendations, booking of tours, and even running to the Farmacia to get my mother-in-law much needed medicine...they ensured that our stay in the hotel and in Rome would be as pleasant and memorable as possible. The rooms are gorgeous and immaculate, the breakfast served in your room each morning was delectible, and again...the service is something you won't even find at top 5- star hotels. Coming from two Manhattanites who travel all the time, we have very high standards which The Roma Boutique Hotel completely surpassed. If you are looking for a close and personal level of service and comfort, then look no further. These four GENTLEMEN will take care of all of your needs and make your stay in Rome incredible. Grazie mille to Alessandro and his staff!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: SouthernCrossings
Reviews.Content: I visited Rome in August, not my first time in Italy, but first time to Rome, and on my own. To be greeted at the airport after a long haul flight with a complimentary transfer, and welcomed warmly at the hotel with map, advice about how to find authentic places to eat, and my first expresso in Italy, was wonderful, I couldn't have asked for better hospitality. I stayed four nights, and found the hotel a welcoming, cool, quiet, and calm oasis after days of sightseeing in the August heat of Rome. This was my first stop in Italy and I couldn't have asked for a better start to my trip.

Reviews.Title: “Don't look any further than the Roma Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LynnSurreyUK
Reviews.Content: Thisis such a great little hotel - it's like having your own apartment in the middle of rome without all the hard work. Alessandro and his staff are absolutley charming and I don't believe it's possible to find more helpful people anywhere. Alessandro, on discovering it was not possible to book our train tickets to Pisa online, actually went off to the railway station and bought them for us - wonderful! The hotel is small and very stylish and the rooms spotless and comfortable. Although small, everything has been provided for the guests comfort and is of such good quality - right down to the toiletries in the bathroom! I wouldn't think of staying anywhere else when we next visit rome.

Reviews.Title: “What a way to spend my 30th!”
Reviews.Author: jasonelson
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend very kindly and very generously treated me to three nights at the Roma Boutique Hotel and wow, from the moment we arrived at the airport we were made to feel at home, perfect location for exploring the city, lovely rooms and the most friendly and helpful staff that I have encountered in a hotel. If you are travelling Rome on business or pleasure I couldn't recommend this hotel enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great, great place. And the best service I've had at a hotel in a long time.”
Reviews.Author: DrHickenlocher
Reviews.Content: While Roma Boutique is not the most fabulous hotel I've ever stayed in my entire life, it was a great, great value and a wonderful place to spend 3 nights while we were in Rome.
