I have to admit that I thought about de-rating this down to a 4 because of one issue, but ultimately left the 5 rating because I DO want this place to succeed, and I think it deserves it. That issue is: the elevator broke before our second night. And Roma Boutique is not a stand-alone hotel, but rather the 4th floor of a multi-use building (5th floor in "American"), and that's a lot of stairs to climb at the end of the night. And it was no picnic carrying our luggage DOWN five flights of stairs at 7am to get to our flight home. But the hotel is just one tenant in the building, and I won't blame them for the malfunction. So on to the review: My wife and I arrived at a non-descript building that doesn't really have a sign saying "Roma Boutique Hotel" anywhere. But we knew we were at #1 Via Toscana. When we entered, a receptionist in an alcove just inside told us to go to the fourth floor. The elevator held a big roller suitcase, a small roller suitcase, and the two of us with my backpack... but not much room for anything else. On the 4th floor, were welcomed quite enthusiastically by the manager, though I didn't get his name. He was very effusively friendly in that Italian-stereotypical way, which is a good thing. His English was pretty good, and he took the time to show us how to work the A/C in the room and show us the room's features. We had Room 26, which is directly adjacent to the lobby. It's just like the room they used for the TripAdvisor photos. Despite sharing a wall with the lobby, we never heard any outside noises, except for the occasional roller suitcase going down the hallway outside our door. No strange sounds at night. The bed was comfortable enough (Queen size, I think). The window opened out to the courtyard, so not much of a view except for the office workers a couple of floors down. Microfridge stocked with overpriced drinks (though we had enough room to squeeze in our own drinks) and a hotel safe both built into the desk drawers. Hair dryer provided. TV carried about 20 or so channels, with CNN and BBC both in (British) English, as well as MTV. I couldn't find any channels playing the US Open, though. THE GOOD: * Breakfast included (and in our room!). The night manager asked us what we wanted each evening, as well as what time we wanted it delivered. Strawberry yogurt, cereal, juices, tea, coffee, croissants, jams, Nutella, fruit tarts, yum! * Bathrobes and slippers included, the only one of our three hotels during the trip to do so. * Bacio chocolates on the pillows at night! * The electrical outlets were adapted for standard European, in addition to Italian-outlet styles. So our converters used in France and Germany worked just fine! * Telephone in the bathroom, as well as on the night-stand, if you need it. * A bunch of bus lines stop right around the corner (Boncompagni stop). Barberini Metro station a ten-minute walk (or 3 bus stops away). 52, 53, 63, and 80 all stop right at an entrance to Barberini for going to the Vatican or Colosseo. All four run right by Trevi Fountain as well on the way home. 910 drops you off a couple of blocks away from Termini Train Station as well. Just be sure to press the "Stop Requested" buttons, otherwise your bus may drive right past the stop if there's no one waiting on the curb. * Lots of nice restaurants nearby. I'd recommend Il Pomodorino. Just be aware it doesn't open for dinner until 7pm. * Immediately next door is a market. Can't be easier to buy water, sodas, juices, chips, etc. * Immediately next door to the market is the local police station. It's really comforting to have three police cars parked outside at any given moment. THE BAD: * The elevator breaking. 5 flights of stairs is not fun. * Not entirely unexpected in a building this old, but if you run the sink while someone is in the shower, the shower gets really COLD. * Almost too many light switches. It's a bit of an adventure trying to figure out how to turn them all off. * Towels were a *little* threadbare. GOOD TO KNOW: * The main doors to the building close at night. You have to buzz in (key for Roma Boutique Hotel is on the right, I think it's A7). The outer door will then swing open automatically and then you can open the inner door. * While there are some things within walking distance, like Villa Borghese and the Spanish Steps, the hotel is not located in the heart of tourist-town, so you really will want to learn the buses. Print out the bus map on atac.roma.it and keep it with you so you'll always know how to get home from wherever you happen to be. All in all, as long as you don't expect some 5-star Ritz with valet parking and bellhops, you'll do just fine. You get a clean room at a truly "boutique" little hotel with great service, in a good location, at a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel & Hosts”
Reviews.Author: Holidaymaker57
Reviews.Content: Had a fantastic time in Roma Boutique Hotel. They location is great. Only a fifteen minute walk to a lot of attractions in Rome and also near the Metro line. Room was gorgeous and Breakfast in Bed each morning was fabulous. Alessandro and all the staff could not have been nicer to us and gave us great recommendations for restaurants and also gave us great tips for sight-seeing. Would definately recommend this hotel to both friends and family. Loved rome and this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: milenaSydney
Reviews.Content: What a great place! I never write reviews but I must write one on this "gem" of a hotel. Great central location, hidden away, stylish and very elegant ......all was catered for. The rooms were plush and the breakfast was a surprise - it was a banquet! The staff are very friendly and thankfully they speak english very well and are very helpful. I will return on vacation next time. 100% in all aspects.

Reviews.Title: “Genuine care for the guest dont get better than this!”
Reviews.Author: Sainterboy1976
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Roma Boutique for 5 nights in early July as part of our honeymoon – and we couldn’t have wished for a better place to stay in the Eternal City. What sets this place apart (from anywhere I’ve ever stayed) is the amazingly genuine and personalised service provided by the staff, particularly Alessandro the manager and Roberto. It is a unique little place in a quiet yet central location – north towards the Villa Borghese gardens (a great "time out" spot from the madness of Rome), but still walking distance to some of the main attractions (15mins to Trevi, Spanish Steps, about 10mins to the Barberini Metro stop). For the time-poor those open-top tourist buses also have a stop literally around the corner. We felt adventurous enough to walk there from Termini on the first day, from memory it was about 25 minutes on foot with bags. If we flew in, Alessandro had even offered to pick us up from the airport. It is on the 4th floor of a commercial building, but this is nothing to worry about it, you wouldnt really know, it is still very quiet, and buzzing in is very easy – infact, as a bonus for the gents, there seems to be some sort of modelling agency on the 2nd floor, and whilst foregoing the lift for the stairs one afternoon, we did have to clamber past a small army of Italian models lining up for a casting call – equating to a more visually pleasing stair climb than the Spanish Steps! ...as my wife now kills me for that comment! Very conveniently there is a supermarket two doors down to stock up in, and the Police station is actually next door, so it’s a very safe area. Our room was very clean and modern (and certainly spacious enough by Italian hotel standards). The bathroom was particularly nice, it was an all new kit out, and the shower was massive! Breakfast delivery to your room is also a nice touch, so again plays on the whole personalised feeling of the place. Alessandro and Roberto also gave us good tips on where to eat (and made the reservations ...and more importantly worded us up on where to avoid), and are ready to answer any questions and help you may require. In summary this is a great little hotel, for couples particularly, who are seeking something a bit different, and an escape from the larger scale chains. I think flicking the coin in the Trevi means I'm returning to Rome one day, and when so, we'll stay here again, no questions asked.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Vacation in Rome”
Reviews.Author: loragreen
Reviews.Content: Roma Boutique is absolutely amazing! After reading many many reviews we booked a four night stay at Roma Boutique, especially after reading the many positive reviews that appaulded the personal service. The hotel was everything we hoped and more and helped to make our stay comfortable and romantic. The hotel is in a great location, with the city tour buses right around the corner. The hotel arranged for a driver to pick us up from the airport and he waited there for two hours while we waited for lost luggage to arrive without charging us more. Alessandro is absolutely amazing; from helping us to arrange train tickets, to directions, to making reservations for us in two delicious and romantic restaurants. The rooms were very clean and spacious for the cost, especially for Rome hotels. Shower was great. There are only about 10 rooms so there is a very intimate feeling about staying at Roma. We were served breakfast every morning to our room. We are going to recommend this hotel to everyone!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: MplsTravelKitty
Reviews.Content: Roma Boutique Hotel was a wonderful oasis for us during our time in Rome. We stayed for 3 nights and found the staff to be very helpful with maps, directions, restaurant recommendations, etc. Housekeeping was immaculate! The rooms are done in a modern design, and the shower is fantastic! We really enjoyed having "breakfast in bed" each morning with wonderful pastries, etc. The location is really quite nice - pretty close to a Metro stop and short walking distance to Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, and Borghese Gardens. The hotel is across the street from the US Embassy, so the area is quite safe. The room was very quite with excellent air conditioning which we appreciated in July! Many thanks to Alessandro, Roberto, and Albert for providing such wonderful help and making it an excellent stay! We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Accommodations!!”
Reviews.Author: rosstbomb
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. The hotel is located on a floor in a commercial building so just tell the taxi driver it is a boutique and to take you to 1 Via Toscana and then you will have to ring the doorbell and they will let you in. You will need to handle your luggage but if you need help go up and ask. From there, everything is wonderful. The rooms are sizeable and contemporary. The breakfast is good. The service is excellent. The place is run by three gentlemen, one of them is the owner. They will do whatever it takes to make you happy. Their dining and touring recommendations were right on. If you are sick of overpaying for poor service in the large corporate chains, try this place.

Reviews.Title: “Very posh, especially for the price!”
Reviews.Author: NYCMarathoner
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent five nights at the Roma Boutique Hotel on our honeymoon. We were thrilled with our deluxe room - private balcony, lots of space, hip decor, great bathroom, very quiet. Room service breakfast every morning was an added bonus, and it came with a cute little news summary from your home country. The staff was very helpful and charming, and the location is well within easy walking distance of the major sights. Overall, it was a surprisingly swanky experience for the price, more so than Sofitel and W. hotels we've been to. One small warning: the elevator is tiny! It was never a problem for us, but we tend to take the stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for a stay in Rome - Look no further”
Reviews.Author: Trajan012
Reviews.Content: I have to say that I have never met such an attentive, detailed, friendly and hands-on hotel manager as Alessandro. He went beyond the call of duty and surprised us with his attention. Following, I will mention of few of Alessandro's details so that you understand what I am talking about. I asked for availability for the hotel through the hotel's website (I recommend you try and book directly with the hotel because you might get a better rate). When I made the reservation, Alessandro offered to arrange for a taxi to take us to the airport at the end of our trip at no extra charge. The last day of our trip, when the taxi arrived, Alessandro personally took our four VERY heavy pieces of luggage to the first floor and helped to pack them in the Mercedes Benz. Another example was seen when we checked out of the hotel. I decided to pay for the hotel bill with all of my remaining euros so that I did not have to bring the euro's back home. After having paid the bill exhausting all of my cash, Alessandro became concerned that I would not have any cash to purchase something to eat at the airport and out of his own initiative offered to give me back a few euros so that I was not left without any euro cash. I have never seen such a gesture from any hotel manager and it just goes to show the quality of the service and attentiveness that Alessandro and his crew provided to us. I rejected Alessandro's offer because I knew that I could pay with my credit card at the airport, but obviously thanked him for his gesture. Another example of the good service occurred when we decided to go to the Borghese Gallery. I just asked Alessandro what did I have to do and he quickly called the Gallery and made reservations for us. Just another example of the top class service at Roma Boutique Hotel. The room itself was stylishly decorated, very clean and although not huge, had sufficient space to have a comfortable stay. The continental breakfast in the morning was delivered to our room and was good. A great attribute of the room that cannot be understated is that it was sound proof. I did not hear noise coming from the outside. You may be surprised at how many hotels in Europe have a problem with this. Therefore, I really appreciated this. In addition, the air conditioning worked perfectly. As for the location, I will just say that it is excellent. The hotel is walking distance from most major attractions of ancient Rome. My advice is that when visiting Rome for leisure, it really pays to have a hotel with good location. You will be able to make the most of your time. The only thing that you should have in mind when deciding to stay in this hotel is that it is in the 4th floor of a commercial building, so it does not have large common areas or amenities such as a bar or pool. However, if you are not looking for those things and are just looking for a nice stylish room, incredible staff and an excellent location from which to see Rome, then look no further and stay at Roma Boutique. The next time that I am in Rome I will definitely stay at this hotel. My wife and I left with beautiful memories from our trip to Rome and this hotel definitely helped in achieving that great experience.

Reviews.Title: “you will love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: itsawonderfulworld
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights following our cruise. The hotel is lovely--looks brand new---and is very comfortable. The staff couldn't be nicer or more helpful. The area is elegant, near the American Embassy, and the Borghese Gardens, and just a few minutes walk from hotels like the Hassler and the Eden. A very good value in this expensive city!

Reviews.Title: “Mille Grazie”
Reviews.Author: WoodyBucks_England
Reviews.Content: We came to this hotel for our honeymoon this june, Absolutely blown away by how you are looked after here, Alessandro and Albert are true gentlemen and we both loved every minute we stayed here. If your looking for class and a friendly face to help you all the way then this is the place for you! Jamie & Emma, England

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: NZgirl8
Reviews.Content: Roma Boutique Hotel is a little gem. Alessandro is a wonderful charming host and he arranged a limo to meet us at the airport. This was much appreciated as the flight arrived after midnight! The room was wonderful with a great bathroom. Breakfast was lovely with wonderful cappuchinos. The staff were always helpful with special thanks to Alberto who checked us in on the first night and Alessandro. We will always have fond memories of Rome and if we return, we will stay at Roma Boutique Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Sophisticated, clean and cozy with a helpful staff in a great Roman neighborhood.”
Reviews.Author: boncukmavi
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Roma Boutique Hotel for the first and last part of our trip to Italy. Alessandro and the entire staff were extremely friendly and helpful every step of our journey. We couldn't have asked for anything more. It was like staying with old friends. The room was clean and comfortable and morning breakfast is brought to your room. The neighborhood is safe and quiet and steps away are great cafes, dining and nightlife. If we're ever in Rome again we will definitely call Roma Boutique Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: hambo73
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 4 nights in May and enjoyed every minute! Wonderful location, beautiful rooms with immaculate furnishings and design, incredible breakfasts served in your room and the friendliest staff you could find. I would highly recommend this hotel and on my next trip to Rome this will be a must stay.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further for your hotel choice in Rome”
Reviews.Author: K10fromNH
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 3 day trip to Rome. My best friend and I found this hotel using "Trip Advisor," and we were extremely satisfied with our choice. The rooms are an excellent size (we both got our own rooms) for European standards and the bathrooms were great. The hot, full pressured shower was welcomed after a long day of walking around the city. The best part of the stay were the gracious hosts. Alessandro, Albert and Roberto went above and beyond to accommodate our every need. I highly recommend that you adhere to their restaurant recommendations. We chose one restaurant on our own and that was the only one we were disappointed with. Every restaurant (for lunch and dinner) was exceptional beyond compare. My friend and I have a fine palette for both food and wine and we were ecstatic about the restaurants. In conclusion, I would highly recommend this hotel and I would return again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay”
Reviews.Author: jonhenri
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay!! super hotel and staff! great breakfast! great returant recommendations!! no complaints!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect.”
Reviews.Author: mcCalg
Reviews.Content: Our family of 3 stayed for 4 nights in early April 2009 on the recommendation of a colleague. Everything listed in the previous reviews is true! The rooms are reasonably sized by European standards and are perfectly appointed. Our rooms backed onto a courtyard and there was zero traffic noise. Allesandro was the perfect host -he recommended restaurants that we would never have found by ourselves and advised on sightseeing, even organized a car to take us to the airport at the end of our trip. We were easily able to walk to all the major sights. Breakfast in our rooms was the ideal start to each day! Highly recommended - we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Jem in the Heart of Downtown Rome”
Reviews.Author: MatthewAC
Reviews.Content: I recently spent a week in Rome, and was extremely impressed with the overall quality and comfortability at the Roma Boutique Hotel. It was clean, beautiful designed, conveniently located, and the service was more than spectacular. If you want to enjoy your Roman vacation in style and comfort, I would highly recommend this Hotel. The location was prime - literally in the heart of downtown Rome. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “excellent experience!!!!”
Reviews.Author: smaroGreece
Reviews.Content: Very stylish hotel ,in an excellent location ,i think the best location in rome,nearby to the most famous monuments and the best shops.Congratulations to Mr Alessandro ,hotel manager ,who enthralled us with his kind gestures-he knows what i am talking about...Many many thanks!!! Smaro.

Reviews.Title: “DEFINITELY RECOMMENDED”
Reviews.Author: GolyDubai
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel ! Stylish and elegant and the service is great and it feels just like home. and it's right in the center next to a supermarket which is really handy. A superb hotel!

Reviews.Title: “stylish hotel !”
Reviews.Author: blik01
Reviews.Content: The beautiful and stylish hotel in a safe area of Rome (near to the Police station and american embassy), near to the metro and the centre. Excellent service, big rooms for the European hotel, free Internet. We'll come back there again!

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS hotel!”
Reviews.Author: daliagrizzard
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 nights at the ROMA BOUTIQUE HOTEL. This tiny boutique hotel is utterly fabulous. It is a small hotel located on the 4th floor of an apartment building which sounds bizarre but makes it all the more charming. The hotel consists of seven or eight rooms and the rooms are lovely - large, clean, very well equipped with ETRO toiletries, PLASMA screens on the wall and comfy beds. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful and couldn't do enough for us 24/7. Breakfast is delivered to the room anytime you wish and is gorgeous, selection of hot drinks, fresh breads, everything, The location is great, very near the Spanish Steps and right next to the WESTIN Excelsior hotel so you can look up where that is located on the map if you are unsure. There are loads of good restaurants on VIA VENETO two minutes away. I am extremely fussy, I hate most hotels finding them unclean and unworthy of the money I have spent on them but I was delighted with the stay I had at the ROMA Boutique hotel and would return there and recommend it to anyone going to Rome. Brilliant!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in all ways”
Reviews.Author: MargarethOslo_Norway
Reviews.Content: We are a trend and quality conscious couple in early fourties. We have travelled a lot with or without our kids. This was a trip for just the two of us. We were in Rome for the first time and looked for a hotel in a quiet, but central location that in addition were good value for money. I spent hours searching for å perfect place and ended up with Roma Boutique hotel. We walked from the central station; it took us 15-20 min to find Via Toscana 1. We were surprised to not find a hotel sign on the building, and hesitated a few seconds before we found the hotel name at the entrance door bell We were welcomed by Alessandro, the owner. He turned out to be the perfect host. Since the hotel had only 7 rooms, we got really personal service and the best recomandations for where to find the best deals in shopping, which restaurants to go to and which sights that were a must. We were really pleased. The room was a bit small, but was very elegant; nice designer lamps, flat screen TV, wifi included in the price, good firm bed with quality linnen. The bathroom was very nice, decorated with small mosaic tiles, nice massage shower and a glass wall between shower and rest of room. Etero designer soap, shower cream and shampoo where replaced every day. Breakfast was served in the room since there were no restaurant connected to the hotel. We found this to be excellent. Great caffe latte, croissants, muffins, butter and jam! The personal touch added by the warm and welcoming staff made this design pearl the perfect place to stay. Close to everything; 10 min walk from spanish steps; 2 min from via Venetos designer stores and 2 min to the closest Metero. We never heard any noise from other guests. This was a nice quiet place. When we were checking out, the perfect host ordered a private driver to take us to the airport for only €40; equal or less than most taxis. This was one of our best trips ever because of this perfect hotel experience! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem!!”
Reviews.Author: Annabelle40
Reviews.Content: As a first time traveller to Europe as well as one travelling alone, the whole experience of choosing where to stay was overwhelming! So many hotels to choose from and so many mixed reviews, it was a challenge to wade through the comments that were relevant to me i.e. was I really concerned about the size of the room? Did the fact that a place had no lift bother me? What I finally and painstakingly decided was that I wanted a place that was comfortable, clean, close to the majority of sights and not too expensive. I didn't think that was too much to hope for, but oh gosh, there's still so much out there to choose from! In the end gut instinct and some positive reviews led me to Roma Boutique hotel...that and the promise of a car to pick me up from the airport!! After all I was a first time visitor to Rome and had no idea where anything was, the last thing I needed was to be bothered with trying to work out public transport or taxis... The driver was there waiting when I arrived, he was very polite and friendly. His English was limited - not that that mattered, he had enough to get by and to point attractions on the way. The car was in great condition, and it felt so good to be taken care of after a long flight from Australia. This was just the beginning of an excellent stay with friendly and professional staff in a well appointed and conveniently located hotel! Someone was at the reception desk 24/7, and they were always ready to help with restaurants, directions, average costs of taxis (so you know what to expect to avoid being ripped off!) The room was a good size, certainly not a ballroom, but ample room for two people to move about in (My friend arrived a day later). Decor was modern and tasteful. The shower was excellent! The bathroom was certainly big enough - no squeezing behind doors or ducking heads, or getting things wet....the toiletries were pretty cute too! Breakfast was served in our room daily and consisted of cereal, fresh bread, pastries, juice and coffee. We walked pretty much everywhere without any bother, but the Metro is close by too for transport to the Vatican or Colosseum. This is one hotel that you could choose without any worry or concern at all! Friendly staff, great location, small, clean, comfortable, close to everything, reasonably priced AND it's got a lift...it's got it all!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Stylish Gem”
Reviews.Author: jxaxnxext
Reviews.Content: This little hotel, hidden on the 4th floor of a building filled with offices, is a gem. At first, looking at the building, we thought we were in the place. You have to ring the bell and they will let you in. Take the little elevator up, and youll find it! It is stylish, comfortable, and quiet. The location was great for us. We were able to walk to the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, and Pantheon in about 15 minutes easily, and on our last day we walked all the way to the Vatican and back! We are good walkers, mind you.. my husband and I are in out early 30s, and my parents (travelling with us) are in their mid 60s and quite healthy. The hotel is down the street from the Westin, and the hotel is on a sidestreet off of Via Veneto, a stylish area with lots of hotels and restaurants. It is a very safe area, as it is down the street from the Polizia station AND the American Embassy! The rooms, though small, were comfortable, stylishly modern and appropriate for European standards. Also very convenient is a small grocery/market down the block for snacks or any items you forgot to pack. Alesandro and all the other gentlemen at the front desk were downright charming. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Find!!!”
Reviews.Author: gnawh2
Reviews.Content: This was our last stop on our 2 week long honeymoon in Italy. what a great way to end it in Rome. We found this hotel on Tripadvisor and Expedia. Loved the modern artsy design and booked a room based on wonderful reviews. The hotel is centrally located. We were able to walk from the main train station to the hotel in about 15 minutes. Not an easy walk with big luggage but definitely do-able. Other options are to take the bus from the train station or subway. Very easy to find in an office building on the 4th floor. We booked a superior room with balcony. Since this hotel is fairly new, everything was in top condition. The bed was very comfy with a normal U.S. size shower!!! we were so happy about the large shower (not hitting our arms against the glass everytime we showered, unlike the small european shower units) with high water pressure!!!! Bravo to Alessandro for his interior design layout! Alessandro and his staff are so helpful and nice. Gave us great suggestions everyday. When we returned each day at night, we simply fill out the breakfast menu paper and breakfast gets delivered to our room at the assigned time. Easy! We got an assortment of breads/pastries with juice, cereal, coffee/cappucino/espresso, and 1 page of news highlights from around the world. We can even put our large water bottles and white wine bottle in the hotel's larger frig until we were ready to drink it. We were able to walk everywhere from the hotel. 10 minutes to the Spanish steps, another 10-15 to the Trevi, and 10 more minutes to the Pantheon. Very nice walk so it really doesn't feel like you've been walking for 45 minutes. We took the subway to the vatican and back. Took the bus to the Colosseum/roman forum/palatino, walked to Trastevere from there and walked all the way back to Roma Boutique hotel from Trastever in 45 minutes. Great restaurant suggestions: 1) "Gioia mia" by barberini subway - yummy mixed grilled vegetables, papardelle Gran Duca and Osso buca. 2) "Dino e Tony Trattoria" by the Vatican - Alla Carbonara pasta, faccocia brea, and tiramisu. 3) "Il Duca" in Trastevere - lasagna, Sattimbucco, Fried zucca, and Flan. Can't wait to return to Rome and stay at this wonderful hotel. Free mercedes benz ride to the airport is a definite A+++. Thanks Alessandro!!!

Reviews.Title: “Chic Boutique Hotel near Vio Veneto”
Reviews.Author: uniquetravelstops
Reviews.Content: A classy small boutique hotel located across from the back side of the American Embassy and one block from the trendy "see and be seen" Via Veneto and across the street from the newly opened Rose Garden Palace (great food in the dining room IL Roseto and reasonably priced for the area) The rooms are modern and very well decorated with hard wood floors with Etro Italian bath products from Milan. You also have travel tooth brushes with mini toothpaste, fluffy robes and slippers. You also get a welcome small bottle of wine and some peanuts with a reasonably priced mini bar. We walked to Trevi fountain from there as well as the spanish steps, it is also by the Villa Borgese park. There is also a hop on hop off stop located 1 block away. (Pay when you get on- this is a great way to cover the highlights of rome and give your feet a break and jump off when you want) The hotel is located in a office building with marble floors and stairs. There is a small elevator that takes you to the entrance located on the fourth floor. They have no breakfast room, but you get to check off what you want the night before and they bring it to your room on a silver tray - which we loved since we are use to drinking coffee while getting ready, so we could eat and head out to venture through Rome quicker! (this is included in your room price) They also paid for our taxi to the Airport, since we found our own way there. The staff is very friendly and courteous. There is a small groceteria 2 doors up which was great as we grabbed some grapes, olives, bread and cheese and snacked in our room with some wine we bought. The only downside to this hotel would be that the bed was harder then we are used to and at times I could smell smoke in the halls. I think the night staff are smokers. There is no concierge or the other amenities of a large hotel, but that is what makes it a boutique hotel, they are generally priced less then a full service hotel. They also have triple pane glass, which means it cuts out any traffic noise, which is important in any hotel in Europe, and why they will usually brag about it in thier adds.(Not all hotels have this and it can be the difference between a good nights sleep or not) . I would go back to the Roma Boutique Hotel again if I return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: GreggregAlessandria
Reviews.Content: Location and Attention of Staff

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: CYRILLE172H
Reviews.Content: A great hotel, near to everything only problem we had was finding it! It is just a door and with a list of names on the intercom there is no sign outside. It was very clean, staff were helpful breakfast is brought to your bedroom, overall we were very pleased staying here.

Reviews.Title: “The Roma Boutique Hotel was Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: ariana55
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Roma Boutique Hotel in November 2007 for 8 nights and had a wonderful experience. I arrived early in the morning on an overnight flight and I was given a room right away, which was much appreciated since I was exhausted. I had a standard room at 150 euro/night which was a great rate (my understanding is that the main difference between the standard and the superior room pertains to the view). The staff was extremely courteous and helpful, especially Alessandro, the manager/owner, who couldn't have been more accommodating. The hotel has the following great features: 1. I requested to be picked up from the airport and the hotel sent a nice Mercedes to help me arrive in style. :-) The driver (Fabio) was very friendly and helped me with my luggage. The cost was 45 euro (cabs normally cost 40 euro). 2. Impeccably clean and modern decor. Rooms are also equipped with a minibar and safe. 3. Room is a decent size and the hardwood floors add a nice touch. You will have plenty of space for your luggage and personal items. The flat screen TV with both Italian and international channels was also nice to have. 4. I was able to access the internet from my room for the entire duration of my stay at no extra charge (rooms are equipped with WiFi and broadband access). I considered this a huge plus! 5. Breakfast is delivered to your room every morning and consists of fresh pastries with jam and delicious Nutella, yogurt, fresh juice, and coffee/tea. Breakfast is included in the room rate, which is another great advantage. 6. Hotel is conveniently located around the corner from the US Embassy and within walking distance from the Barberini, Spagna and Repubblica metro stops, 5 minutes away on foot from the posh Via Veneto. The hotel only has 6 or 7 rooms on the 4th floor of an office building, so be sure to reserve in advance. I would contact the hotel directly for better rates ([--]). The one suggestion I would make if you are a very light sleeper like me is bring ear plugs if you want to sleep until late in the morning (I had the room right next to the reception area and I could hear things, but with my ear plugs I was able to sleep like a baby). Overall, I would highly recommend the Roma Boutique Hotel! You won't be disappointed. Ariana L, November 2007

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: Seanieod
Reviews.Content: Central location and within 10 mins. walk of the city centre. Very clean and funky room. Breakfast was room service only (as this isn't a hotel in the conventional sense of the word) but good quality. Price per room can vary wildly depending on the dates you choose but I recommend contacting the hotel directly and they might cut you a deal!

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: VivNewZealand
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect - we could not fault it. From helpful staff, fabulous bathrooms, cleanliness, super location - everything as well as value for money. You could not ask for more. Roma Boutique Hotel has my vote.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, so helpful and understanding”
Reviews.Author: BMLNewZealand
Reviews.Content: We asked for an early check-in, and it was no problem, which gave us heaps of time for sightseeing. The staff couldn't have been more helpful, and a plus for us was that they spoke perfect english.. Comfy bed, and even though the room overlooked the street, it was quiet at night. Great having the little supermarket right next door too. Very modern, and quite spacious. Great bathroom. In a very handy location too. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Small is the Word. Rooms are very trendy decor.”
Reviews.Author: RayPS
Reviews.Content: So.. No outside signs or foyer. No Bellman. No sign on Front Door of hotel which is on the 4th floor of an office building. ( very common of Pensiones in Rome). An entry way with reception and a long hallway with 6 rooms. It feels very clandestine and unmarked to preserve your privacy... That said, the rooms are very well appointed but small by US standards, average by European. Staff super friendly and helpful. Breakfast in your own room. Bathroom very cool. Trendy Orange curtains and modern decor. Someone was smoking so hallway was very smokey but room itself had wonderful AC and ventilation.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant loved it”
Reviews.Author: hkingett
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel on the 7th June for 3 nights and all I can say is that we throughly enjoyed it. we had no problems with the room size. there was plently of storage for our clothes, a nice sized bathroom, free internt access and a nice T.V. Our room over looked the street but it was not a problem as it was not noisy and I enjoyed looking out onto the beautiful street anyway. (we stayed in ML) I dont understand why people moan about non speaking english channels, you are in a foreiegn country!!!! The room size was as I would expect in Roma for a good priced hotel like this and to be honest I've stayed in hotels in England that are Far smaller and not as clean (the hotel was VERY clean) We found the Hotel a very pleasent experience. The hotel staff where VERY VERY helpful and a joy to talk to, the hotel 's location is fantastic, it is located on a beautiful street and within walking distance of all Roma's major attractions. Breakfast is included either in your room or outside inthe nice cafe below which is very pleasent people watching in the early morning sunshine. All in all I would reccomend this Hotel to ANYONE (perhaps not with children as it a small boutique hotel as the name suggests) but as business or a nice break for loved ones it is perfect. we couldn't of asked for any more. Please dont be put off. my boyfriend is a very seasoned traveller and he enjoyed it very much. A wonderful small hotel thats is throughly delightful.

Reviews.Title: “Size isn't everything.....”
Reviews.Author: mandyelmo
Reviews.Content: Our arrival at the hotel was a roller coaster of emotions. When my boyfriend and I first arrived outside the address of the hotel we were not entirely sure what to expect. There's no grand foyer. Unfortunately on our arrival the lift wasn't working so we had to take a lift at the other end of the building which happened to take us to the back of the hotel. This meant my boyfriend and I had to walk through the store room which was a mess and made me panic - thankfully my boyfriend was quite relaxed and kept his calm. Once I got over this initial shock I realised that this hotel is small and is basically an entire floor of an office block. There are only a handful of rooms which are individually decorated and petite in size however the quality of the rooms is fantasic (5 star) !!! and I would recommend this to any couple or business person staying in Rome for a few days. This isn't suitable for children. Our bathroom was a wet room and was very comtemporary complete with a beeday (not sure of spelling) - with quailty toiletries, bathrobes and slippers provided. Breakfast was served in our room - the breakfast consisted of bread, croisants and jam with a choice of coffee / tea and yogurts. All very nice. Theres a plasma screen in every room with limited english speaking channels. We discovered a Spar shop next door open till about 6pm that sold everything you would need. The metro was 5 mins walk away - Spanish steps 10 minute walk.
